TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit TypeToTypeInfoMarshaler extends System.Object implements class System.Runtime.InteropServices.ICustomMarshaler

Docs.summary: Marshals the unmanaged interface to the managed class, and marshals the managed class to the unmanaged interface.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `ITypeInfo` interface exposed for a .NET type is based on the metadata that would appear in an exported type library. Likewise, the <xref:System.Type> instance exposed for an `ITypeInfo` interface is based on the metadata that would appear in an imported assembly.
The Type Library Importer (Tlbimp.exe) marks `ITypeInfo` parameters with the appropriate <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.MarshalAsAttribute> with the <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.UnmanagedType.CustomMarshaler> enumeration member when converting signatures that use `ITypeInfo` parameters to signatures that use <xref:System.Type> parameters.
The same conversion functionality can be accomplished without the custom marshaler, by calling <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal.GetITypeInfoForType%2A> and <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal.GetTypeForITypeInfo%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: public TypeToTypeInfoMarshaler ();
.method public static specialname rtspecialname void .cctor() cil managed
Public Sub New ()
public: TypeToTypeInfoMarshaler();

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > This member is removed in the .NET Framework version 2.0 and subsequent versions.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void CleanUpManagedData (object pManagedObj);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void CleanUpManagedData(object pManagedObj) cil managed
Public Overridable Sub CleanUpManagedData (pManagedObj As Object)
public: virtual void CleanUpManagedData(System::Object ^ pManagedObj);
abstract member CleanUpManagedData : obj -> unit override this.CleanUpManagedData : obj -> unit

Docs.param: The managed object to be destroyed.
Docs.summary: Performs necessary cleanup of the managed data when it is no longer needed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The CLR calls this method to clean up managed data allocated in the <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.CustomMarshalers.TypeToTypeInfoMarshaler.MarshalNativeToManaged%2A> method.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void CleanUpNativeData (IntPtr pNativeData);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void CleanUpNativeData(native int pNativeData) cil managed
Public Overridable Sub CleanUpNativeData (pNativeData As IntPtr)
public: virtual void CleanUpNativeData(IntPtr pNativeData);
abstract member CleanUpNativeData : nativeint -> unit override this.CleanUpNativeData : nativeint -> unit

Docs.param: A pointer to the unmanaged data to be destroyed.
Docs.summary: Performs necessary cleanup of the unmanaged data when it is no longer needed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The CLR calls this method to clean up the unmanaged data allocated in the <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.CustomMarshalers.TypeToTypeInfoMarshaler.MarshalManagedToNative%2A> method.

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Runtime.InteropServices.ICustomMarshaler GetInstance (string pstrCookie);
.method public static hidebysig class System.Runtime.InteropServices.ICustomMarshaler GetInstance(string pstrCookie) cil managed
Public Shared Function GetInstance (pstrCookie As String) As ICustomMarshaler
public: static System::Runtime::InteropServices::ICustomMarshaler ^ GetInstance(System::String ^ pstrCookie);
static member GetInstance : string -> System.Runtime.InteropServices.ICustomMarshaler

Docs.param: String "cookie" parameter that can be used by the custom marshaler.
Docs.summary: Returns an instance of the custom marshaler.
Docs.returns: An instance of the custom marshaler.

remarks.format: ## Remarks All custom marshalers must implement this method, although it is not part of the <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ICustomMarshaler> interface definition.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual int GetNativeDataSize ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 GetNativeDataSize() cil managed
Public Overridable Function GetNativeDataSize () As Integer
public: virtual int GetNativeDataSize();
abstract member GetNativeDataSize : unit -> int override this.GetNativeDataSize : unit -> int

Docs.summary: Returns the size in bytes of the unmanaged data to be marshaled.
Docs.returns: -1 to indicate the type this marshaler handles is not a value type.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Because custom marshaling of value types is not supported in the .NET Framework, this method always returns -1.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual IntPtr MarshalManagedToNative (object pManagedObj);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance native int MarshalManagedToNative(object pManagedObj) cil managed
Public Overridable Function MarshalManagedToNative (pManagedObj As Object) As IntPtr
public: virtual IntPtr MarshalManagedToNative(System::Object ^ pManagedObj);
abstract member MarshalManagedToNative : obj -> nativeint override this.MarshalManagedToNative : obj -> nativeint

Docs.param: The managed object to be converted.
Docs.summary: Marshals an object from managed code to unmanaged code.
Docs.returns: A pointer to the unmanaged object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The CLR calls this method with the specified instance of a managed object to convert that object from managed code to unmanaged code, and it returns a pointer to the appropriate unmanaged object, representing the COM view of that object.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual object MarshalNativeToManaged (IntPtr pNativeData);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object MarshalNativeToManaged(native int pNativeData) cil managed
Public Overridable Function MarshalNativeToManaged (pNativeData As IntPtr) As Object
public: virtual System::Object ^ MarshalNativeToManaged(IntPtr pNativeData);
abstract member MarshalNativeToManaged : nativeint -> obj override this.MarshalNativeToManaged : nativeint -> obj

Docs.param: A pointer to the unmanaged object to be converted.
Docs.summary: Marshals an object from unmanaged code to managed code.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The CLR calls this method with the specified pointer to an unmanaged object to convert that object from unmanaged code to managed code, and returns a managed object representing the managed view of the unmanaged data.
